abstract: The Japanese call maitake the "dancing mushroom." In Chinese medicine, it is considered an immunity enhancer.
snippet: The Japanese call maitake the "dancing mushroom." In Chinese medicine, it is considered an immunity enhancer.
lead_paragraph: The proliferation of steady rains from August onwards has yielded a stunning crop of mushrooms this fall, both edible and otherwise. Recently, I found a lovely maitake mushroom cluster that weighed over two pounds growing at the base of a giant pin oak near where I was staying just outside New Paltz. The maitake had grown over and around a fallen branch, and there were a few acorns attached to the bottom. I took the whole thing home.
